thread.title: Jets notes: Sheldon Richardson may start
thread.title_full: Jets notes: Sheldon Richardson may start

title: Jets notes: Sheldon Richardson may start
text:
Jets notes: Sheldon Richardson may start October 15, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
Richardson may start 
Jets coach Todd Bowles still doesn’t know how much DE Sheldon Richardson will play Sunday against Washington, but he admitted Wednesday it’s possible Richardson could start. 
"Depending on what package [the Redskins] come out in, he may" start, Bowles said. "There’s things in there for him. I’m not going to say he is or he isn’t [starting]. If they come out in something else and he doesn’t [start], that makes me out to be a liar." 
Richardson will be returning to action after being suspended for the first four games this season for violating the NFL’s substance-abuse policy. 
Bowles indicated Richardson likely will play more than 10 snaps, but he won’t play the whole game. 
Jackson getting closer 
Washington WR DeSean Jackson hasn’t played since suffering a hamstring injury on opening day, but he practiced on a limited basis Wednesday and coach Jay Gruden said he is "very, very close" to returning. However, neither one would commit to Jackson playing against the Jets. 
CB Darrelle Revis, who likely would be matched up against him, isn’t worrying about Jackson’s status. 
"I don’t care if he plays or not," Revis said. "It’s about us as a team." 
Jackson said in August he believes "no one can guard me," not even Revis or Seattle’s Richard Sherman. When asked if those comments mattered to him, Revis said, "No, not at all." 
College spirit 
Rookie DE Leonard Williams, the sixth overall pick in this year’s NFL draft, wore a USC T-shirt in the locker room, two days after the school dismissed coach Steve Sarkisian. "I’m wearing the T-shirt because I’ve still got to represent," Williams said, "and at a time like this is when I’ve got to represent most." 
Williams called Sarkisian a "great guy" and indicated he saw no evidence of issues with Sarkisian while around him. Sarkisian reportedly is having alcohol-related problems. 
— J.P. Pelzman
